title: Emmerdale battles Hollyoaks as stars go glam for Inside Soap Awards
text:
Get the biggest soaps stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Emmerdale stars led the way as the Inside Soap Awards kicked off.

Rebecca Sarker and Katherine Dow Blyton were among the first to arrive at the showbiz bash in London tonight.

Rebecca, who plays Manpreet Jutla in the ITV soap, looked gorgeous in a black off-the-shoulder ruched dress as she hit the red carpet.

Katherine, who stars as Harriet Finch, opted for a pretty floral floor-length dress, perfect for a glam look on a chilly winter night.

The cast of Emmerdale picked up a number of prizes at the bash, including Best Bad Girl for Louisa Clein and Best Partnership for Dominic Brunt and Lucy Pargeter.

(Image: WireImage)

(Image: WireImage)

Hollyoaks star Imran Adams headed to the bash too.

The actor, who plays Mitchell Deveraux in the Channel 4 soap, looked sharp in black trousers and a double breasted jacket.

Lauren McQueen, who portrays Lily Drinkwell in the show, looked gorgeous in a white trouser suit, with a sparkly silver top underneath.

(Image: WireImage)

(Image: WireImage)

Sally Dexter, who stars in Emmerdale as Faith Dingle, looked pretty as a picture as she braved the cold in a knee-skimming white dress, emblazoned with a huge floral design.

X Factor star Rachel Adedeji was repping Hollyoaks tonight as she turned up the glam in a beautiful pink fringe minidress.

The singer and actress, who plays Lisa Loveday, will have plenty to celebrate after the show scooped the Best Soap prize.

(Image: PA)

(Image: WireImage)

Liam Fox, better known as Dan Spencer in Emmerdale, went for a checked navy suit and white shirt.

Newly-engaged Hollyoaks couple Daisy Wood-Davis and Luke Jerdy arrived together.

The cute pair wrapped their arms around each other as they posed up for pictures.

Daisy, who played Kim Butterfield, looked sensational in a dogtooth jumpsuit, while Luke, who stars as Jesse Donovan, was dressed to impress in smart trousers and a jacket.

(Image: WireImage)

(Image: PA)

Former Coronation Street star Bhavna Limbachia, who played Rana Habeeb, looked gorgeous in a black dress with lace detailing.

She was joined by on-screen sisters Sally Dynevor and Connie Hyde, Corrie's Sally Metcalfe and Gina Seddon, who posed for a snap together.

Sally looked beautiful in a black tunic dress, while glam Connie added a splash of colour in an electric blue frock.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

Dominic Brunt, who plays Paddy Kirk in Emmerdale, clutched his Best Partnership award as he posed up on the red carpet in a smart suit jacket and blue shirt.

EastEnders' Rukka Nahar, who plays Habiba Ahmed, went for a very bold look on such a cold night.

The actress headed to the awards in a floor-length red skirt and a strapless gold sequined bralet.

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

Louisa Clein, who played teacher Maya Stepney in Emmerdale, posed up proudly with not one, but two awards in her hands.

The actress, who looked gorgeous in a red animal print dress, won two awards, including Best Bad Girl, for her grooming storyline.

Katie McGlynn oozed glamour in an extremely low-cut white dress.

She's soon to make her exit from Coronation Street when her character Sinead Tinker tragically loses her cancer battle.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

X Factor's Jake Quickenden, who is joining Hollyoaks in a guest role, beamed a big smile as he posed up at the awards.

He looked smart as can be in a grey three-piece suit and black roll-neck jumper.

(Image: Getty Images)

This year's Inside Soap Awards are being held at London venue Sway, where some of the UK's biggest soap stars are gathering together under one roof.

Readers of Britain’s best-selling soap magazine have voted over the summer for their favourite stars and shows – in 18 categories from Best Actor and Actress to Best Shock Twist, Best Partnership and, of course, the all-important Best Soap.

Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 33033
description: A host of soap stars braved the cold to head to this year's Inside Soap Awards in London in the hope of picking up some prizes
